alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 08 at 11:10AM PST until December 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. -Snow: Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. -Wind: Strong, gusty south winds could bring down tree branches and create very difficult driving conditions for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant blowing snow that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
